title: 108_s851
content: The "Child Custody Protection Act" may be cited as the title of this Act. Title 18, United States Code, is amended by adding a new chapter 117A regarding the transportation of minors in circumvention of certain laws relating to abortion. The "Child Custody Protection Act" adds a new chapter 117A to Title 18, United States Code, addressing the transportation of minors across state lines for abortions, in violation of parental involvement laws. Offenders face fines or imprisonment for up to one year. The "Child Custody Protection Act" imposes fines or imprisonment for up to one year for performing an abortion on a minor in a state other than where she resides without parental consent or notification. Exceptions include cases where the abortion is necessary to save the minor's life due to physical disorders or injuries. Exceptions to the "Child Custody Protection Act" include abortions necessary to save the minor's life due to physical disorders or injuries. Minors transported in violation of the act cannot be prosecuted, and there is an affirmative defense if the defendant reasonably believed they had parental consent. The "Child Custody Protection Act" provides an affirmative defense for those who reasonably believed parental consent was obtained before a minor's abortion. Parents can seek relief through civil action for violations of the act. The "Child Custody Protection Act" allows parents to seek civil action for violations of laws requiring parental involvement in a minor's abortion decision. The "Child Custody Protection Act" defines a parent as a guardian, legal custodian, or person standing in loco parentis with care and control of the minor. The term minor refers to an individual who is not older. The "Child Custody Protection Act" defines a parent as a guardian, legal custodian, or person with care and control of the minor, who is designated by the law requiring parental involvement in the minor's abortion decision. The term minor refers to an individual who is not older than the maximum age requiring parental notification or consent under the law. "117A. Transportation of minors in circumvention of certain laws relating to abortion."
